topHeadline: Super Tuesday cements a Bidenâ€“Trump rematch
snippet: Fifteen nominating contests delivered decisive delegate hauls for both campaigns.
lead: Voters in 15 states handed sweeping victories to President Biden and former President Trump, effectively locking in a general-election rematch and shrinking the field of alternatives.

events.title: Biden sweeps every Democratic contest but American Samoa
events.summary: The president dominated the Super Tuesday map, reinforcing party backing even as long-shot protest votes continued to register.

events.title: Trump romps across GOP field, Haley takes Vermont
events.summary: Donald Trump netted commanding victories in the Republican primaries, while Nikki Haley notched an upset win in Vermont but suspended her campaign the next day.

events.title: Democrats eye turnout warning signs
events.summary: Strategists flagged underwhelming primary participation in key swing states, worrying about enthusiasm in November.

topHeadline: Senate passes bipartisan border and foreign aid package
snippet: A rare cross-party coalition advanced funding for Ukraine, Israel, and Indo-Pacific allies.
lead: After days of procedural hurdles, the Senate approved a $95 billion security package that pairs overseas aid with modest border enforcement adjustments, setting up a clash with House Republicans.

events.title: Senate moves $95B aid bill with 70-29 vote
events.summary: The supplemental includes support for Ukraine, Israel, and Taiwan alongside humanitarian funding.

events.title: House conservatives vow to block the package
events.summary: Speaker Mike Johnson signaled the bill was 'dead on arrival,' citing insufficient US border changes.

events.title: Biden urges House to act quickly
events.summary: The White House warned that Ukraine's front lines risk collapse without immediate congressional action.

topHeadline: Trump wins Iowa GOP caucuses in a landslide
snippet: The former president set a modern record for a non-incumbent in the opening contest.
lead: Braving subzero temperatures, Iowa Republicans delivered Donald Trump a 30-point margin over Ron DeSantis and Nikki Haley, underscoring his dominance heading into New Hampshire.

events.title: Trump captures 51% of the caucus vote
events.summary: He cleared the 50% threshold for the first time in modern Iowa GOP history for a non-incumbent.

events.title: DeSantis edges Haley for second
events.summary: Florida's governor argued his runner-up finish keeps him viable, though the path forward remains narrow.

events.title: Democrats run mail-in 'caucus'
events.summary: State Democrats shifted to mostly absentee participation with results delayed until Super Tuesday.

topHeadline: Colorado Supreme Court removes Trump from 2024 ballot
snippet: A first-of-its-kind ruling applied the 14th Amendment insurrection clause to a presidential candidate.
lead: In a 4-3 decision, Colorado's high court found Donald Trump engaged in insurrection on January 6, ordering the secretary of state to exclude him from the Republican primary ballot, a decision immediately appealed.

events.title: Majority cites Section 3 of the 14th Amendment
events.summary: The court concluded that the former president's efforts to overturn the 2020 election triggered the Civil War-era disqualification clause.

events.title: Trump campaign vows swift appeal
events.summary: Campaign lawyers said the U.S. Supreme Court must settle the question to avoid electoral chaos.

events.title: Other states watch closely
events.summary: Activist groups pursued similar lawsuits nationwide, though most had been rejected before Colorado's breakthrough.

topHeadline: Ohio voters enshrine abortion rights in state constitution
snippet: Reproductive rights advocates secured a decisive win viewed as a bellwether for 2024 races.
lead: Ohioans approved Issue 1 with nearly 57% support, continuing a streak of post-Dobbs victories for abortion-rights campaigns even in Republican-leaning states.

events.title: Issue 1 passes with a 13-point margin
events.summary: The amendment protects access to abortion up to viability and allows post-viability exceptions for patient health.

events.title: DeWine says lawmakers must respect the vote
events.summary: Ohio's Republican governor acknowledged the outcome while hinting at future regulatory tweaks.

events.title: Democrats net wins in other key races
events.summary: Kentucky's governor held on, Democrats flipped Virginia's House of Delegates, and Pennsylvania retained a liberal supreme court majority.

topHeadline: Hamas attacks Israel, triggering regional conflict
snippet: Surprise assault from Gaza kills hundreds and prompts massive Israeli military response.
lead: Hamas militants launched coordinated attacks across southern Israel, killing over 1,200 people and taking hostages, while Israel declared war and began intensive airstrikes on Gaza.

events.title: Hamas breaks through Gaza border barriers
events.summary: Militants used paragliders, boats, and ground forces to attack Israeli communities near the Gaza Strip.

events.title: Israel declares state of war
events.summary: Prime Minister Netanyahu vowed to destroy Hamas capabilities and called up military reserves.

events.title: US pledges support for Israel
events.summary: President Biden condemned the attacks and promised military aid while urging restraint.

topHeadline: Congress averts shutdown with 45-day funding bill
snippet: Last-minute deal keeps government open but kicks budget battles down the road.
lead: The House and Senate passed a 45-day continuing resolution just hours before a midnight deadline, preventing a government shutdown but leaving major spending disputes unresolved.

events.title: McCarthy relies on Democratic votes
events.summary: The House Speaker needed Democratic support after hardline Republicans rejected the deal.

events.title: Ukraine aid included in stopgap
events.summary: The bill includes $6 billion in aid for Ukraine, though future funding remains uncertain.

events.title: Conservative backlash threatens McCarthy
events.summary: Hardline Republicans vowed to challenge McCarthy's speakership over the compromise.

topHeadline: Trump indicted in Georgia election interference case
snippet: Fourth criminal indictment targets efforts to overturn 2020 election results.
lead: A Fulton County grand jury indicted Donald Trump and 18 co-defendants on racketeering charges related to attempts to reverse Georgia's 2020 election results.

events.title: RICO charges filed against 19 defendants
events.summary: The indictment alleges a criminal enterprise to overturn election results through false statements and pressure campaigns.

events.title: Willis seeks March 2024 trial date
events.summary: Fulton County DA Fani Willis wants the case to begin before the 2024 election.

events.title: Trump calls indictment 'witch hunt'
events.summary: The former president denounced the charges as politically motivated and vowed to fight them.

snippet: Central bank continues inflation fight despite economic uncertainty.
lead: The Federal Reserve increased its benchmark interest rate by 0.25 percentage points to a range of 5.25% to 5.5%, the highest level since 2001.

events.title: Fed signals more hikes possible
events.summary: Chairman Powell said future decisions will depend on incoming economic data and inflation trends.

events.title: Markets react positively to clarity
events.summary: Stock markets rose as investors welcomed the Fed's measured approach to monetary policy.

events.title: Housing market feels the pressure
events.summary: Mortgage rates near 7% continue to dampen home sales and construction activity.

snippet: Mercenary leader's march on Moscow ends in deal with Putin.
lead: Yevgeny Prigozhin's Wagner Group captured military facilities and marched toward Moscow before abruptly halting their rebellion and accepting exile in Belarus.

events.title: Wagner seizes Rostov-on-Don
events.summary: The mercenary group took control of Russia's southern military headquarters without resistance.

events.title: Putin calls rebellion 'treason'
events.summary: The Russian president vowed harsh punishment for those involved in the mutiny.

events.title: Belarus brokered deal to end crisis
events.summary: President Lukashenko negotiated an agreement that halted Wagner's advance on Moscow.

topHeadline: Biden, McCarthy reach debt ceiling deal
snippet: Agreement averts default but includes spending cuts and work requirements.
lead: President Biden and Speaker McCarthy announced a framework to raise the debt ceiling through 2025 while implementing modest spending reductions and new work requirements for some social programs.

events.title: Deal raises debt limit through 2025
events.summary: The agreement would suspend the debt ceiling until after the next presidential election.

events.title: Spending caps for two years
events.summary: The deal includes modest spending reductions and caps on discretionary spending growth.

events.title: Work requirements for food stamps
events.summary: The agreement expands work requirements for some SNAP recipients while exempting veterans and homeless individuals.

topHeadline: Trump arraigned on criminal charges in New York
snippet: First former president to face criminal prosecution in US history.
lead: Donald Trump pleaded not guilty to 34 felony counts of falsifying business records related to hush money payments made during the 2016 presidential campaign.

events.title: Historic arraignment at Manhattan courthouse
events.summary: Trump became the first former president to be criminally charged and arraigned in US history.

events.title: Charges center on Stormy Daniels payment
events.summary: The indictment alleges Trump falsified records to conceal payments to adult film star Stormy Daniels.

events.title: Trump calls charges 'political persecution'
events.summary: The former president denounced the prosecution as politically motivated and vowed to fight the charges.
